text: you have to understand that when you say
delivering of relief goods to the
victims we are also the victims and
that's why we needed help from the
national government to supplement and to
support us so that we can get our
equipment running our trucks running and
our people going and that's obvious I
mean that that's a clear-cut proof that
you know that we were we were hit hard
the mayor has there been enough
coordination between the national
government and the local governments in
the relief effort
there's the coordination is loud and
clear I think the problem is the
coordination between the national
government here and the national
government in Manila because the
national government here and the local
government we're doing what we can with
what we have but if we don't have it you
know then what can we do that we're
operating in one two trucks it's already
how many days it's now it's just now
that the trucks are starting to arrive
and now that the employees are starting
to report after they buried their dead
the problem here there are no markets
open there's no center wherein they can
just go and get food so when we go to
the areas we have to deliver food now
the problem is in some areas some of the
people are not there because they're
still looking for their loved ones
they're still looking for food so what
we did initially what we did now in the
last couple of days when the local
government took full control already of
distributing the goods we were able to
distribute to the entire city in one day
and in fact we're doing now the second
cycle I don't want to make any
statements that will be negative or any
statements that will just create
animosity between the national
government and the local government if
there are mistakes I hope the national
government will correct it but we're all
in our knees here and we were just
begging to get these things done let's
address you know the problems
immediately and let's just do what we
have to do
